result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher C Lidbury was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full with cash bond from 15CM316.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his/her system. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall remain in compliance with AODA assessment and driver safety plan as ordered in 14CT183.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher C Lidbury

Defendant Christopher C Lidbury in court with attorney Eric Paul Pitsch.  
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
No contest plea entered.

Plea accepted after rights explained and defendant is found guilty. 
Recommendations by counsel.

Sentence withheld, 1 year probation ordered.

- pay costs/supervision fees 
- not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV 
- not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his/her system 
- not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood
